title: What is the most abusively powerful champion in 5.8?
body:

Well then these nerfs weren't even noticeable. I've mained Malphite since Beta...

I kind of agree, Malphite is very strong in my opinion but he doesn't have a very high skill ceiling. He has a pretty predictable style of play that will be countered pretty easily the higher you go in Elo. I'm 4-0 on him when I have played him in ranked so give him a try, I find him fun :p

he is definitely a wonderful tank. I take him jungle, but top is good too. He thrives against AD comps, and can still do perfectly good against AP ones/mixes. He does damage(a lot for a tank, think Maokai as well), he shuts down AD carries VERY hard, with MS slow, knock-up, AND AS slow. His only, and I'd definitely say his only drawback is that he can only gank with his ult up/his team should NEVER fight without his ult up. Oh yeah Cinderhulk adds even more damage to his already powerful AoE.

Malphite is flat better than Sejuani but he never gets noticed as a viable Sejuani alternative in the last 2 months because Sejuani did more AOE damage. Malphite's damage is burst. He's more fun to build AP but is more effective as pure tank.

He's also easier to use than Amumu but Amumu gets banned for living longer than Malphite even though Malphite wins more teamfights.

{{champion:79}} {{champion:69}} are too powerful right  now.

Cassiopeia currently wins every lane matchup and even if she loses, scales way too hard number-wise.

Blitzcrank can make the game an instant 4v5 with a good grab. Gragas can make it 3v5 while also dealing absolutely absurd damage.

I agree with Gragas, but Cass?
Lux, Morgana, and Karma SHIT on Cass.
take Cass top and all her problems disappear. She bullies harder than Pantheon while never falling off.
This is pretty true, unless they counter you with someone who can jump on you, but she does do well against immobile tanks.
Most champs that can  jump on her can't do so safely at level 2. She can start bullying at level 2. The burden is on the enemy champ to kill her while all Cass has to do is poke and farm.
And she scales harder than any one of them.

What made Gragas too powerful? 

Was it the extra 100 mana at lvl 1?

Was it the 10% extra slow to his Q?

Was it the extra damage to his W to monsters? 

Or is it simply that he's a tank jungler who can apply pressure early?

I'm thinking the last statement, and honestly, Sejuani is still stronger than him.

The things I mentioned were the changes that were made to him since his winrate was standing at 45%. He's really just flavor of the month, and after the Cinderhulk nerfs go through in 5.9, he won't be as much of a menace. His Ult is gamechanging when used correctly and that is really the only thing that I see is overwhelmingly strong. If they need to do anything else to Gragas, I hope it's just increasing the CD of his Ult. His absolutely absurd damage comes from what? He has low scaling and his abilities base damages are average. He only has his W for late game damage because it's percent health damage. Compare that with Sejuani who has %health damage and damage that scales off of HER max HP. She has more CC than Gragas and a passive that let's her stick to targets and gain bonus resistances. The only thing that Gragas has over her is his sustain in the jungle due to his passive (and this in turn allows him to apply more pressure early in the game). I guess you could argue that displacement is better than an AOE stun, but 1.75 seconds is a long time in league to be standing huddled together doing nothing with 2 or more of your buddies while a boar rider and her posse are charging at you. 

Gragas hovers at a comfortable 50% winrate these days and people think he's more broken than any other champ out there. I know winrates don't mean everything but he's not a mechanically challenging champion. He only begins to show an above average performance at higher levels of play which might be reason for concern, but I don't think he's far off from being healthy (in other words, he may need a _small_ nerf, and the Cinderhulk nerf may be all he needs). I think people are seeing Gragas as the Lee Sin of tanks; he has pressure early, he stays healthy in the jungle, and he is incredibly safe. If Gragas is in trouble, he has his E, is Q and his Ult to help him get away. Just like Lee Sin has his W ward hopping and his low CD Ult to keep himself safe. This is what I think people really hate about Gragas. He's fairly slippery and annoying to deal with because of how surprisingly mobile he is. 

Now in all fariness. I don't think that Gragas needed the last few buffs I mentioned in the beginning. He was a good tank champion before they were added. People just didn't know how to build him since they nerfed his AP build. He can still build AP, yes, but he's much less effective than before due to his Q no longer being a safe way to farm minions, which is what made him strong. He could stay back and farm until he wanted to fight, but now he has to walk up or E into a minion wave to help clear it which puts him in harms way. However, when he builds tank, he doesn't have to worry about harass as much, so he can Q-E a minion wave without worrying about getting bursted down after his abilities are on CD. In the Jungle, he's even better because he no longer has the damage reduction on his Q, allowing him to farm camps early with ease. I think that the recent buffs to him were unnecessary, but regardless, he is a strong pick right now in pro play due to his very powerful Ult (not because of damage, but because of the displacement). Placed correctly, it can win you the teamfight and the game. Placed incorrectly, you successfully kill your entire team. I think Gragas is fairly balanced right now (possible reverts of the last few buffs and he would still be fine), but he is annoying as hell to play against and that and due to how popular he is, are the reasons that people hate him so much. aka the Lee Sin effect

In response to all of you, i've made a decision. I haven't been playing long enough to compare modern {{champion:54}} to season 2. For me, he's an aoe tank with a devastating ultimate. I'm going to try him out. 

Also, to the person recommending supports, I completely understand and I can inform you that my main is {{champion:267}} and besides that, {{champion:111}}.

I'm extremely grateful for all your help.

In terms of broken champs, most AoE CC bruiser/tanks are really good right now. Stuff like{{champion:32}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:120}} .

{{champion:92}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:238}}  have been always great for carrying when you are significantly better than your MMR bracket. 

If you're in a lower elo (bronze/silver), want to climb, and have a lot of free time I recommend spamming support as much as possible, especially dashless backline supports like {{champion:40}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:37}}. This is really good for your MMR for a number of reasons:

1. You'll gain a lot of positional awareness, since you need to be out of range of AoE/assassins but in range to shield/heal/poke.
2. You'll get a lot better at poking the enemy laner - easy to learn in bot lane but helps in all roles except jungle.
3. Most people support because they have to, not because they want to. Matchmaking isn't really able to take this into consideration, so if you've practiced a lot of support your team will, on average, be better than the enemy team.
4. These types of support are good in nearly every meta and teamcomp, so it's pretty unlikely you'll have someone yelling at you.

Sure you'll get "uncarriable" games or whatever every once in a while, but if you're even slightly better than your opponents your LP gains will skyrocket.

Gragas is way to powerful imo. I've never seen a gragas do poorly in like 2 months now. They either do ok or carry the game. It's never something in the middle.

I think that's the thing to look out for in soloq. If someone either does ok or ultra carry the game that's probably the best pick you can get since there's no downside to it.  It was like the old tristana, either she won lane and won the game 1v5 or she lost lane but still scaled well enough to do decent.

{{champion:120}} {{champion:113}} are tied for first right now, having either one of these champions greatly increases your team fighting/pick/engage capabilities. and can really carry important team fights.
